page.title: 11RISDEN'S WOOD,HARLOW
page.content: This is a large area-nearly 1/4km2 of open woodland next to Parndon Wood and Crematorium.The wood is not fenced,and there are several rides running through it for the walker.There are wooden bridges over the streams. At the northern end,most of the trees are hornbeams,with a few oaks,silver birch and poplar.Few plants grow under these trees,so woods are open.Insects are abundant here and provide a varied food supply for birds.The trees provide cover for birds to nest and food for squirrels and mice. In the Southern part-Hospital wood-a wider range of trees grows.There is more undergrowth and sunny clearings. Foxes and rabbits live here. There is a steepsided pond in the middle of the wood and moisture loving trees grow nearby.Photo 3 shows the pond.
